page.description: Returns the path to the Windows special folder specified

argument.name: FolderPath
argument.description: The path to the specified Windows special folder.

argument.name: WindowsFolder
argument.description: The name of one of the special folders listed in the table below or a NULL string if the folder does not exist.

page.discussion: The WIN_SPECIAL_FOLDER() function returns the path to the specified Windows special folder, such as the Desktop folder, the Start Menu folder, and the Personal Documents folder. Returns an empty string if the requested folder is not available or not valid. For example, Windows 95 does not have an AllUsersDesktop folder and returns an empty string if folder is specified as AllUsersDesktop. The following special folders are available:

item.name: AllUsersDesktop
item.description: Shortcuts that appear on the desktop for all users.

item.name: AllUsersStartMenu
item.description: Shortcuts that appear on the Start menu for all users.

item.name: AllUsersPrograms
item.description: Shortcuts that appear on the Programs menu for all users.

item.name: AllUsersStartup
item.description: Shortcuts to programs that are run on startup for all users.

item.name: Desktop
item.description: Shortcuts that appear on the desktop for the current user.

item.name: Favorites
item.description: Shortcuts saved as favorites by the current user.

item.name: NetHood
item.description: Objects that appear in Network Neighborhood.

item.name: Recent
item.description: Shortcuts to current user's recently opened documents.

item.name: SendTo
item.description: Shortcuts to applications that show up as possible send-to targets when a user right-clicks on a file in Windows Explorer.

item.name: StartMenu
item.description: Shortcuts that appear in the current user's start menu.

item.name: Startup
item.description: Shortcuts to applications that run automatically when the current user logs on to the system.

item.name: Templates
item.description: Application template files specific to the current user.

section.title: Example
section.example:
? win_special_folder("Desktop") = "C:\Documents and Settings\JDoe\Desktop"
? win_special_folder("MyDocuments") = "C:\Documents and Settings\JDoe\My Documents"
? win_special_folder("Fonts") = "C:\WINDOWS\Fonts"
? win_special_folder("AllUsersDesktop") = "C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Desktop"
